title: Advanced Information Literacy and Data Analysis Program for Mathematics Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic information retrieval skills, experience in math education, and understanding of formulas/expressions at or above the high school level
context.additional_context: Customized information literacy education for pre-service and in-service teachers to strengthen mathematical research competencies. Emphasizes integrated proof, statistical, and geometric approaches in curriculum design.

learning_goals: Applying reliability evaluation criteria for mathematics academic materials with 85% accuracy, verifying rigor in research methodologies and statistical analyses.
Analyzing ≥3 math education research papers (equation modeling, probabilistic approaches) within 48 hours using information retrieval strategies to derive core concepts.
Submitting project deliverables visualizing mathematical information (graphs, function representations) via digital tools (Desmos, GeoGebra).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
